interest	japan expected cut base rate for state bodies japan expected cut the base lending rate for state financial institutions pct from part the recent pact major industrial nations paris finance ministry sources said they said the cut based revision the trust fund bureau law which should approved parliament march abolishing the pct minimum interest rate deposits with the bureau the bureau channels funds government financial institutions for public works and other official uses they said the base lending rate for state bodies such the japan development bank people finance corp and the finance corporations local public enterprises usually moves tandem with long term prime rates the sources said however was impossible for them follow the last cut pct from pct january because the trust fund bureau rate was legally set pct the ministry will abolish the minimum rate and introduce market related one resolve the problem and stimulate the domestic economy they said tuesday the ministry allowed long term bankers cut their prime record low pct effective february the move suggested had reached agreement with depositors using the bureau the postal savings system the posts and telecommunications ministry and the japan welfare annuity the ministry health and welfare the sources said these ministries are trying determine which market rates should considered when setting the bureau deposit rate the ministry sources said coupon rates new year government bonds minus percentage points the likeliest choice they added reuter

crude	indonesia seen crossroads over economic change indonesia appears nearing political crossroads over measures deregulate its protected economy the embassy says new report counter falling oil revenues the government has launched series measures over the past nine months boost exports outside the oil sector and attract new investment indonesia the only asian member opec and leading primary commodity producer has been severely hit last year fall world oil prices which forced devalue its currency pct september but the embassy report says president suharto government appears divided over what direction lead the economy appears nearing crossroads with regard deregulation both pertains investments and imports the report says primarily assesses indonesia agricultural sector but also reviews the country general economic performance says that while many government officials and advisers are recommending further relaxation there are equally strong pressures being exerted halt all such moves this group strongly favours import substitution economy the report says indonesia economic changes have been welcomed the world bank and international bankers steps the right direction though they say crucial areas the economy like plastics and steel remain highly protected and virtual monopolies three sets measures have been announced since last may which broadened areas for foreign investment reduced trade restrictions and liberalised imports the report says indonesia economic growth calendar was probably about zero and the economy may even have contracted bit this the lowest rate growth since the mid the report notes indonesia the largest country south east asia with population million facing general elections april but the report hold out little hope for swift improvement the economic outlook for early indications point slightly positive growth rate not exceeding one pct economic activity continues suffer due the sharp fall export earnings from the petroleum industry growth the non oil sector low because weak domestic demand coupled with excessive plant capacity real declines construction and trade and reduced level growth agriculture the report states bankers say continuation present economic reforms crucial for the government get the international lending its needs new world bank loan mln dlrs last month balance payments support was given partly help the government maintain the momentum reform the bank said reuter

money-fx	gulf bond stock markets lag behind gib says gulf money markets have grown reasonably well during the past decade but bond and stock markets remain large extent fragmented and lag behind gulf international bank bsc gib said the bank economist henry azzam said review gulf capital markets that investors have relinquish traditional investment vehicles such real estate foreign currency bank accounts and precious metals greater financial sophistication needed coupled with more diversified capital market instruments and change the disclosure requirements company accounts said the gib study reviewed capital markets under three categories money markets stock and bond markets azzam said gulf states had been making greater use short term money market instruments and banks the region had floated various euronotes and underwriting facilities nevertheless bond and stock markets remain large extent fragmented and lagging behind said most debt the region still raised syndicated loans and bank facilities and very few companies had made use stock bond issues only kuwait has official stock exchange while other gulf nations have yet establish exchanges but with dwindling financial surpluses the gulf governments are actively pursuing ways develop capital markets and set domestic stock exchanges azzam said said recession stemming from sliding oil prices had clearly had negative impact the development capital markets the region addition family firms are reluctant public financial awareness among investors still lacking and investment analysis and corporate reporting standards lack depth sharp fall share prices the early prompted investors hold shares hoping for eventual recovery azzam said the absence proper commercial law some gulf countries and authorities apparent reluctance adopt financial innovations had also hampered capital markets called for clearly defined laws governing incorporation joint stock companies and the flotation debt instruments azzam said capital market instruments should made available all citizens and institutions gulf cooperation council gcc states bahrain kuwait qatar oman saudi arabia and the united arab emirates uae some moves had been taken this direction with bahrain allowing gcc nationals own pct locally incorporated companies azzam said gulf money markets had received greater depth from the introduction treasury bill offerings bahrain and the expansion securities repurchase regulations saudi arabia but added there bond market speak saudi arabia qatar oman the uae with the last saudi riyal denominated bond issued while bahrain plans official stock exchange and trading saudi arabia has picked establishment formal exchanges qatar oman and the uae does not appear imminent azzam said reuter

purolator stock tender offer begin thursday the rest the shares will purchased for securities and warrants buy stock subsidiary acquisition containing purolator courier operations all the shares purolator are tendered shareholders would receive for each share dlrs cash six dlrs debentures and warrant buy shares subsidiary acquisition containing the courier operations hutton said the merger shareholders would get mln dlrs aggregate amount guaranteed debentures due acquisition and warrants buy pct the common stock the courier subsidiary hutton said the company has valued the warrants two three dlrs per share purolator stock price closed dlrs friday while some analysts estimated the company was worth the mid least one said would worth dlrs this follows sales two other purolator units agreed recently sell its canadian courier unit onex capital for mln dlrs and previously sold its auto filters business purolator retains its stant division which makes closure caps for radiators and gas tanks hutton spokesman said the firm reviewing its options stant purolator courier business has been lagging that its rivals because the high price paid the past several years add air delivery its ground fleet hutton will provide mln dlrs its funds complete the transaction this called bridge financing will replaced later with long term debt most likely the form bank loans hutton said hutton lbo committed keeping the courier business its president warren idsal said purolator lost mln dlrs over the last two years largely due courier operations which believe the management turning around belive will very serious competitor the future said idsal william taggart chief executive officer courier division will chief executive officer the new company the tender offer will conditioned minimum two thirds the common stock being tendered and not withdrawn the expiration the offer well certain other conditions the offer will begin thursday subject clearances from the staff the interstate commerce commission and will expire business days after commencement unless extended reuter

outcome the winter crops martell and other analysts said where the crop really made broken still ahead agriculture department authority the ussr said the soviet union recently reported that nine mln hectares winter grain will have reseeded due winterkill this would equal about pct the total winter crop and would the second highest winterkill ten years the usda analyst said with timely spring caused inadequate snowcover combined with cold temperatures this winter however snowcover soviet grain areas has generally been excellent the bulk winterkill analysts speculate likely has been due very dry fall and subsequent poor crop germination fall dryness may problem there good correlation between mediocre crops and fall dryness martell said precipitation last fall was little pct normal southern and northern ukraine and below normal over the entire winter crop area she said recent cold temperatures grain areas which the snowcover has been gradually melting could also have caused problems ice crusting and winterkill jim candor senior forecaster for accu weather said livestock feed needs have probably increased because the fall and winter analysts said the dry fall damaged pastures the cold winter raised feed demands and late spring would require longer off pasture feeding they said the soviets are not desperate situation they don have buy grains now usda official said that excess liquidity threatened money supply and inflation targets bankers said the move represented change tactic the bank which until now has relied raising interest rates choke off money supply strong they know that controlling inflation will make industry more competitive and bring down unemployment the long run added the head another foreign bank said that only month ago the bank spain had only pct less sec enforcement actions recent years but they have increased significantly cases brought during the past five years compared cases the preceeding years markey said did not favor banning delayed postponed customers unwilling pay fixed opec prices lukman during brief visit london his way home from jamaica told reuters telephone interview that february opec had underproduced partly because members were strictly abiding production quotas and partly because they were resisting the temptation sell discounts official prices around dlrs barrel are determined stand firm the december accord said have spoken every other opec minister and they are committed making the accord work said lukman gave specific figures for february output said the opec secretariat vienna was finalizing these figures told reuters survey published today which estimated that opec output far this week was below mln bpd said that could well correct opec news agency opecna today issued statement saying group output was well below its ceiling february but gave figures but one source close opec indicated that february output may have been between and mln bpd the reuter survey estimated opec february quotas iraq which said would not honour its mln bpd quota under the december pact had produced less than had been anticipated said lukman said that some industry reports may correct that february nigeria propuced bpd below its mln bpd quota saudi arabia bpd less than its mln allocation and qatar pct under its bpd quota said that sweet crudes such those produced his country were coming under price pressure because they were currently officially priced above sweet north sea grades and the united states west texas intermediate wti crude however said opec december had anticipated that demand would slack this time year for seasonal reasons and expected the market firm two three weeks have patient for two three weeks the market now firming actual fundamentals said adding that expected and having less problems with output than producers like his own country because they exported oil products also some venezuela heavy grades were outside the opec pricing system said lukman said that refiner buyers now refusing lift some opec oil official prices instead used their own stocks and ran them down dangerous levels they would eventually have buy opec oil when they realise not free for important know that terms with them were negotiable flexible and under constant review not only when the market seemed weak said that far meeting the seven nation ministerial differentials committee crude	crude oil prices stocks output fall crude oil prices rose above dlrs barrel this week and industry analysts said the price could rise another dollar inventories fall opec keeping its production down and the cash market there tight supply crude with short transportation time major refining centers said daniel mckinley oil analyst with smith barney harris upham and that could send prices cts dollar higher added the benchmark crude west texas intermediate rose dlrs barrel today rise dlrs this week the rally oil prices this week came after prices fell february more than two dlrs from its high dlrs barrel oil traders were pulling prices down the assumption that oil stocks were building and opec was producing well above its mln bpd quota but now both those assumptions have come under question mckinley said yesterday the international energy agency its monthly report said that oil stocks the oecd area industrialized nations were drawn down mln bpd during the first quarter this year iea estimates that the draw oil stocks during the first quarter this year will come largely from oil companies whose inventory levels april one will estimated mln tonnes about days consumption industry analysts also said the estimate mln bpd draw stocks made shell chairman peter holmes yesterday fed speculation that other major companies were destocking traders said the destocking has come about result called buyers strike which kept refiners from buying officially priced opec oil effort get the organization offer discounts the official price this struggle between the companies and opec the ultimate game chicken but will resolved relatively soon would imagine about the middle the month march the general trading manager international oil company told reuters telephone interview for its part opec has moved win this game cutting excess supplies from the market reduction its own output traders said reuter survey estimates opec output mln bpd this week also earthquake ecuador yesterday led suspend oil exports indefintiely and force majeure its shipments this will reduce short haul availabilities about bpd almost immediately and the longer the suspension continues the larger the draw stocks will for companies expecting there mckinley said international oil traders said that other short haul crudes such north sea brent were also scarce because asian refiners bought the oil after absorbing lot the readily available mideast crudes earlier this week this pattern continues then oil companies will bid the price oil they purchase for their refineries trading managers several companies told reuters but there were skeptics who said they wondered how long opec can retain its unity buyer resistance continues stephen hanke chief economist friedburg commodity management said opec production was lower because the saudi cut mln bpd and this could spell trouble gives other members incentive exceed their quotas added the saudis will picking the tab for other members who produce over their quota and the drain the saudis will continue forcing them cut output maybe low mln bpd support the dlrs average price added there are also signs some opec crudes being sold the spot trade	study says canada pact would spur economies free trade pact between the united states and canada could spur the economies both sides substantially according study released the institute for international economics the study paul wonnacott said successful conclusion the free trade talks now under way could raise canada gross national product more than five pct and expand export about seven pct said the pact could resolve the knotty issue government subsidies end curbs trade services and investments and pave the way for new global talks under the general agreement tariffs and trade the united states and canada the world two biggest trading partners with cross border shipments about billion dlrs year opened free trade talks last june they are aiming for pact next october wonnacott economics professor the univerity maryland said agreement should include elimination tariffs between the two countries phased over five year period equal access federal government procurement the two countries replacing current buy america and buy canada provisions with buy north america provision fewer restrictions trade services chiefly finance and transportation commitment not screen foreign investments favor domestic producers commission resolve bilateral trade disputes wonnacott said that resolve the subsidy problem the two sides should permit export subsidies exports pct without imposing coutervailing duties the limit subsidies now pct proposed that any attempt impose new duties offset subsidies should first special disputes commission for resolution early stage wonnacott said bilateral free trade would contribute the efficiency the north american economies and their competitiveness facing overseas producers said would would open markets canadian goods and enable them benefit from the economies mass production benefits the united states would fewer than those canada proportionately said because the already large gross national product wonnacott said also that canada pact such areas export subsidies and the creation dispute commission could set example for the current attempt gatt write new and more liberal global trading regulations reuter

renovation cbt spokesman told reuters the exchange was looking number options identify the most cost effective and efficient way proceed including one which would involve moving the entire grains floor out the building and into the nearby midamerica commodity exchange one cbt chairman karsten mahlmann agenda items has been proceed with renovation the financial futures room the spokesman said another cbt official executive vice president george sladoje said the issue would discussed this friday special meeting the exchange floor number presentations have been made with regard renovating the financial futures room sladoje said looked five six different alternatives involving such things flip flopping the trading rooms added conceivable that under couple these plans might use the midamerica exchange temporarily for some cbt markets sladoje said move out one floor entirely then the construction period will about year said adding that the issue was likely membership vote first and then the drawing board for eight months year the cbt spokesman stressed that discussions were very preliminary this stage and nothing was likely begin until this summer the earliest order renovate the crowded financial futures pits exchange officials have discussed providing them temporary home next door the present grains dominated area this could involve moving cbt markets treasury bond futures treasury notes muni bonds and options bonds and notes through adjoining corridor while utilizing the midamerica floor for such cbt futures contracts corn wheat soybeans soybean products and agricultural options any such moves could meet with opposition among some cbt members one senior floor trader said the financial futures room badly needs renovating there talk the grains floor will shift the midam and the financials will move the grains area said the cbt spokesman said another option being discussed was renovate the financial floor quadrants one quarter time the first step after deciding the most effective way proceed would get architectural and engineering drawings said added that was difficult present determine exact time frame for any possible moves this major undertaking and process that would spread out over next year said floor traders the midamerica commodity exchange which merged with the cbt about year ago said they were preparing vacate their floor the end this month space has recently been cleared for them the cbt moving its major market index pit into the area once reserved for lightly traded cbt gold and silver futures which now share their trading area the midam specializes mini contracts grains livestock metals financials and foreign currencies well some options contracts rumor has that the cbt grains are coming over here because the bonds are too crowded one midam trader said another source the midam said this change could take place july august reuter

money-fx	economic spotlight ems marks eighth birthday the european monetary system marks its eighth anniversary still vulnerable turmoil world money markets despite creating island currency rate stability europe economists say but many economists say the system which holds eight european community currencies within narrow fluctuation bands remains its infancy its new currency the european currency unit ecu has been runaway success with investors and borrowers alike seeking alternative the volatile dollar and wednesday the long term vision the ecu europe common currency took step nearer becoming reality when belgium minted the world first ecu coin but economists say members such west germany have far blocked second stage development envisaged the system founding fathers west german chancellor helmut schmidt and former french president valery giscard estaing under this phase originally due have started two years after the ems was set decision making was have been transferred from national governments and central banks autonomous european monetary fund but members have jealously guarded their sovereignty economic and monetary matters the basic problem the ems that governments are not prepared make the quantum leap situation where certain decisions are taken common said one economist who has closely watched the system development the result that the often divided over policy third currencies accentuating what the economists say the system greatest weakness its vulnerability weak dollar over the past months the dollar plunged and investors moved into strong currencies the resulting sharp rise the west german mark severely strained the system more the mark soared against the dollar also rose against ems currencies less favoured international investors and west germany last year refused give pressure from several partners and the united states cut interest rates slow the mark rise the ems had realigned twice ease financial and trade strains within the community two months ago the mark and the dutch guilder were revalued three pct and the belgian and luxembourg francs two pct against other currencies the system the french franc italian lira the irish punt and danish crown another frustration has been britain failure lend the ems political support keeping the pound still major world currency outside the system change the british government attitude expected before the country next general elections due mid meanwhile the system last realignment the since was set prompted european finance ministers ask the highly secretive monetary committee and committee central bank governors come with suggestions for reinforcing their ideas are due unveiled when finance ministers hold informal meeting belgium early next month but economists said the proposals are unlikely involve more than tinkering with technical details they are sceptical about the chances for any fundamental change technical measures won enough protect the ems against external factors such dollar weakness for that must take the step forward the institutional level said leo corel kredietbank economic research department economists say the system fortunes now will depend largely the success agreement last month among major industrial nations stabilise exchange rates the dollar resumes its slide the ems could for more turbulence they predict reuter

money-fx	after round one goes central banks central banks have easily beaten back the foreign exchange market first test the industrialized nations recent pact stabilize currencies analysts said active trading this week the market pushed the dollar sterling the canadian dollar and australian dollar higher but operators got their fingers burned one one the central banks signalled their displeasure far has been roaring success said james neill financial markets economist marine midland bank the central banks are sending strong signals that they won tolerate any kind momentum building behind currencies added senior corporate trader one bank february the finance ministers and central bank governors the japan west germany france and the the group five plus canada signed accord under which they agreed cooperate closely foster stability exchange rates around prevailing levels the agreement was viewed many the market attempt put floor under the dollar after its sizeable two year decline against major world currencies and initially traders indicated their respect for the accord refraining from pushing the dollar lower but wednesday the dollar climbed more than marks about five pfennigs above its levels the friday before the accord the move was aided indications that the economy picked steam february the same time the west german economy was regressing but dealers said the federal reserve bank new york gave traders sharp reminder that the pact had encompassed the idea limiting inordinate dollar gains well declines dealers differed whether the central bank actually intervened sell dollars above marks simply telephoned dealers ask for quotes and enquire about trading conditions but the dollar quickly backed off hovered today around marks the market was surprised that the fed showed its face soon said marine midland neill also wednesday london dealers said the bank england intervened the open market sell sterling the currency rose dlrs compared with dlrs before the pact sterling along with the other high yield currencies like the australian dollar and canadian dollar was favor after traders surmised that the the chance intervention pursuant the paris currency accord left limited room for profit plays dollar mark and dollar yen the pound also was boosted suggestions improving economy anticipation popular british budget march and public opinion polls showing good chances for the incumbent conservative party any general election there was real run sterling said anne mills shearson lehman brothers inc sterling traded today around dlrs down from dlrs last night slid marks from yesterday and from peak about recently there been some heavy profit taking sterling mark ahead next tuesday budget said james mcgroarty discount corp speculators detected the presence the and british central banks they acclerated their shift into canadian and australian dollars but here too they were stymied the bank canada acted slow its currency rise the canadian dollar traded per dollar today down from yesterday and the australian reserve bank using the fed agent sold australian dollars the yesterday dealers said the australian dollar fell low cents today from high thursday analysts said the central banks moves stifle sudden upward movement leave the market uncertain about its next step today the focus shifted the yen which has held very tight range against the dollar for several months the dollar fell yen from last night analysts said the yen also gained traders unwound long sterling short mark positions established lately because the change perceptions about the health the german economy the funds from those unwinding operations are ending yen dealer one bank said recent west german data have shown falling industry orders lower industrial output and slowing employment gains moreover the yen benefitting japanese entities who have invested heavily overseas for example australian financial instruments repatriate their profits ahead the end the japanese fiscal year march noting that the dollar yen rate sense the most controversial one because the large trade deficit with japan analysts said the stage could set for another test the dollar downward scope against the japanese currency its latest review the foreign exchange market through the end january the federal reserve revealed that intervened protect the dollar against the yen january that day the dollar fell low yen sure the fed bought dollars near the yen level january but the market has bear mind that time marches and the situation changes said mcgroarty discount reuter

crude	saudi oil minister foresees need for new opec measures before june 
crude	saudi oil minister sees need alter opec pact saudi arabian oil minister hisham nazer said opec december agreement stabilise oil prices dlrs barrel was being implemented satisfactorily and there was immediate need change nazer interview with reuters and the television news agency visnews said saudi arabia was producing around three mln barrels per day bpd crude oil well below its opec quota saudi arabia the world largest oil exporter will continue restrain production long other opec members adhere the pact nazer said the nation opec agreed december cut its production ceiling pct mln bpd and abide fixed prices averaging dlrs barrel from february nazer his first interview since succeeding ahmed zaki yamani last october said not foresee any need for new measures before the june when our next opec meeting will take place scheduled nazer said opec was producing below mln bpd and all members were abiding its agreements heard news every now and then violations but they were not all verified said opec production curbs have boosted world oil prices from year low around eight dlrs barrel last august near dlrs after announcement the december pact spot market prices slipped some two dlrs february but have firmed the past two weeks near opec levels traders gained confidence opec price and output discipline nazer said saudi arabia would continue produce below its mln bpd quota necessary defend the dlr price long all the opec members adhere the program devised december saudi arabia will continue adhere the agreement said current production three mln bpd includes oil from the neutral zone shared with kuwait but not sales from floating storage nazer said king fahd saudi arabia interview with reuters and visnews march said the kingdom wanted oil price stability and called non opec producers avoid harmful competition with opec saudi arabia doesn decide prices itself but certainly desires price stability said nazer said the output level did not mean the kingdom had returned role swing producer within opec saudi arabia allowed its output sink low two mln bpd august compensate for slack demand and over production some opec states saudi arabia not playing that role being played opec membership whole because the reduction the mln bpd share opec the market being shared other members opec nazer said nazer said opec estimated demand for its oil during third quarter this year would around mln bpd but said circumstances changed sure then the opec members will consult with each other and take the necessary measures oil analysts say the opec pact could come under strain when demand for petroleum products generally falls the northern hemisphere spring and summer nazer said was satisfied with the extent cooperation from non opec producers norway egypt and the the and japan juergen becker director the bundesbank division banking law and credit supervision said the british proposals were interesting but declined elaborate but banking sources said west bankers expect rule changes this year all alterations must approved the bundesbank west germany four major banking associations and the federal banking supervisory office talks have been slowed the fact that fundamental changes would require revision germany credit law which has been effect since authorities favour reinterpreting the credit law fit present circumstances order avoid the long parliamentary political process changing banking sources said since the beginning the banking law has limited banks lending times shareholders equity plus reserves consolidated basis but lending ratios not extend several newer instruments such spot and forward currency contracts currency and interest swaps commercial paper programs currency options interest rate futures foreign currencies and various innovative types interest rate hedges the sources said the main value the proposals lay differentiating between different types risk factor and for instance placing greater weight currency swaps than interest swaps but even german banking authorities agree with some the assessments swaps they disagree how find balance sheet equivalents for the risk british proposals include complicated series formulae for assessing the stream payments involved swaps whose ultimate risk borne the financial intermediary especially when counterparties remain anonymous this the called market market value but german authorities are likely consider this much too complex and base their evaluation instead schedule lending ratings assigned according the creditworthiness the borrowers involved the sources said the weightings also likely lending ratios are extended include banks securities portfolios are zero for public authorities pct for domestic banks pct for foreign banks and pct for other foreign and non bank borrowers further complication that the more flexible definitions equity allowed the and the may put german banks competitive disadvantage the sources said stricter definitions here also mean the use version the proposals could far exceed the intent the and british authorities the sources said one specialist for dresdner bank said long dated foreign exchange forward transaction could for instance brought under the same rule cross currency swap despite the fact that the risk may entirely different how new regulations will affect foreign banks here was uncertain many have converted full subsidiary status and applied for full banking licence over the last two years order lead manage mark eurobonds but their equity capital fairly small tight lending ratios will trade	trade interests ready for fight congress lawmakers are gearing for showdown between protectionists and free traders major trade bill winds its way through committees vote the full house representatives late april move toughen enforcement trade laws key house subcommittee last week approved toned down version legislation require president reagan retaliate against foreign countries that follow unfair trade practices this bill will the cornerstone congressional efforts restore competitiveness american industries and turn around last year record billion dlrs trade deficit several lawmakers have argued the new trade bill made too many concessions reagan and said they intend back amendments get tough with countries that violate trade agreements keep out products the other hand congressmen known for their allegiance free trade said the bill ties reagan hands too much trade disputes and they will seek restore his negotiating powers republican bill frenzel michigan said the subcommittee bill was not one that free trader like could endorse all respects but emphasized there was consensus among trade lawmakers work toward bill reagan and republicans would ultimately endorse frenzel said the goal trade legislation was make our trade policy stronger without violating our international trade agreements you find lot people who think have not done the former enough you find poeple who think haven avoided violating agreements key concession made the urging the powerful chairman the house ways and means committee the trade subcommittee backed off requirement that would have forced reagan automatically impose quotas tariffs imports from countries that engage unfair trade practices also agreed may waive any retaliation would hurt the economy ways and means chairman dan rostenkowski illinois democrat insisted the more moderate approach was necessary the house wanted pass bill reagan would sign into law reagan last year had blocked senate consideration tough house trade bill branded protectionist and this year only reluctantly agreed support trade bill when saw democratic leaders were determined pass bill indication his success white house spokesman marlin fitzwater told reporters friday the administration still did not like some provisions but added generally feel very good about the bipartisan consideration the trade legislation think are progressing very well the first battle will take place next week when the full house ways and means committee considers amendment rep richard gephardt missouri democrat force countries such japan south korea and taiwan cut their trade surpluses with the united states the subcommittee limited the gephardt plan provide only that the existence large trade surplus with the united states will trigger investigation unfair trade practices but would not automatically set off retaliation rep phil crane illinois republican and staunch free trader said will try further weaken the gephardt plan organized labor has pressed lawmakers for more relief from imports where jobs have been lost foreign competition afl cio president lane kirkland this year angered the administration statement that any trade bill reagan would sign would not worth passage congress but rostenkowski set the tone the trade debate statement not trying write legislation please lane kirkland trying write legislation that will signed the president writing the bill the subcommittee rejected calls for trade relief for specific industries such textiles rep jenkins democrat from georgia agreed hold off his fight intends push separately bill protect the domestic textile and shoe industry aide said reagan vetoed similar measure last year house speaker jim wright texas democrat one the most influential proponents aid for specific industries beset low priced foreign competition wright thursday renewed his call for import relief for the domestic oil industry and announced his support for senate plan trigger temporary oil import tariff when imports reach half domestic consumption for the most part the trade bill provisions toughen enforcement trade laws the bill forces the administration act rapidly complaints unfair trade practices such dumping products the united states prices below the cost production also forces the administration act rapidly when industry complains that surge imports threatens its existence congressmen said the change would have required the international trade commission impose limits car imports reuter

money-fx	economic spotlight ems marks eighth birthday the european monetary system marks its eighth anniversary still vulnerable turmoil world money markets despite creating island currency rate stability europe economists say but many economists say the system which holds eight european community currencies within narrow fluctuation bands remains its infancy its new currency the european currency unit ecu has been runaway success with investors and borrowers alike seeking alternative the volatile dollar and wednesday the long term vision the ecu europe common currency took step nearer becoming reality when belgium minted the world first ecu coin but economists say members such west germany have far blocked second stage development envisaged the system founding fathers west german chancellor helmut schmidt and former french president valery giscard estaing under this phase originally due have started two years after the ems was set decision making was have been transferred from national governments and central banks autonomous european monetary fund but members have jealously guarded their sovereignty economic and monetary matters the basic problem the ems that governments are not prepared make the quantum leap situation where certain decisions are taken common said one economist who has closely watched the system development the result that the often divided over policy third currencies accentuating what the economists say the system greatest weakness its vulnerability weak dollar over the past months the dollar plunged and investors moved into strong currencies the resulting sharp rise the west german mark severely strained the system another frustration has been britain failure lend the ems political support keeping the pound still major world currency outside the system change the british government attitude expected before the country next general elections due mid meanwhile the system last realignment the since was set prompted european finance ministers ask the highly secretive monetary committee and committee central bank governors come with suggestions for reinforcing their ideas are due unveiled when finance ministers hold informal meeting belgium early next month but economists said the proposals are unlikely involve more than tinkering with technical details they are sceptical about the chances for any fundamental change technical measures won enough protect the ems against external factors such dollar weakness for that must take the step forward the institutional level said leo corel kredietbank economic research department economists say the system fortunes now will depend largely the success agreement last month among major industrial nations stabilise exchange rates the dollar resumes its slide the ems could for more turbulence they predict reuter

trade	trade interests ready for battle house lawmakers are gearing for showdown between protectionists and free traders major trade bill winds its way through committees vote the full house representatives late april move toughen enforcement trade laws key house subcommittee last week approved toned down version legislation require president reagan retaliate against foreign countries that follow unfair trade practices the bill will the cornerstone congressional efforts restore competitiveness american industries and turn around last year record billion dlrs trade deficit generally the bill provisions toughen enforcement trade laws the trade bill forces the administration act rapidly complaints unfair trade practices such dumping products the united states prices below cost production also forces the administration act rapidly when industry complains that surge imports threatens its existence writing the bill the subcommittee rejected calls for trade relief for specific industries such textiles several lawmakers have argued the new trade bill made too many concessions reagan and said they intend back amendments get tough with countries that violate trade agreements keep out products but congressmen known for their allegiance free trade said the bill ties reagan hands too much trade disputes and they will seek restore his negotiating powers bill frenzel said the subcommittee bill was not one that free trader like could endorse all respects but emphasized there was consensus among lawmakers work toward bill reagan and republicans would ultimately endorse the goal trade legislation was make our trade policy stronger without violating our international trade agreements said key concession made the urging ways and means committee chairman dan rostenkowski the trade subcommittee backed off requirement that would have forced reagan impose automatically quotas tariffs imports from countries that engage unfair trade practices also agreed the president may waive any retaliation would hurt the economy rostenkowski insisted the more moderate approach was necessary the house wanted pass bill reagan would sign into law reagan last year blocked senate consideration tough house trade bill branded protectionist and this year only reluctantly agreed support trade bill when saw democratic leaders were determined pass such legislation white house spokesman marlin fitzwater told reporters late last week that the administration still did not like some the bill provisions but added generally feel very good about the bipartisan consideration the trade legislation think are progressing very well the first battle will take place next week when the full house ways and means committee considers amendment rep richard gephardt force countries like japan south korea and taiwan cut their trade surpluses with the the subcommittee limited the gephardt plan provide only that the existence large trade surplus with the united states will trigger investigation unfair trade practices but would not automatically set off retaliation organized labor has pressed lawmakers for more relief from imports where jobs have been lost foreign competition afl cio president lane kirkland this year angered the administration when said any trade bill reagan would sign would not worth passage congress but rostenkowski set the tone the trade debate saying not trying write legislation please lane kirkland trying write legislation that will signed the president rep jenkins intends push separately bill protect the domestic textile and shoe industry aide trade	oecd agrees export credit reforms the western industrialised nations have agreed reforms rules which they provide credit for exports developing countries the organisation for economic cooperation and development said the reforms tighten the rules for the use foreign aid subsidise export credits called mixed credits the oecd said the agreement implemented two stages july this year and july means the minimum aid component mixed credits will raised pct from pct and pct for credits covering exports the world least developed nations additionally new formula will used for calculating the aid element mixed credits take account different interest rates the exporting countries the nation oecd which hosted the reform negotiations said minimum interest rates for officially subsidised trade loans have also been revised with the aim cutting the subsidies and ending them completely loans relatively rich developing countries july next year the reforms follow several years pressure the stop competitors notably france and japan using foreign aid subsidise exports putting firms disadvantage oecd officials said the agreement was based provisional accord reached january subject ratification member governments some governments including austria had linked their final approval other trade credit issues which would discussed meeting here mid april they added raising the minimum amount aid required mixed credits the agreement aims make such hidden subsidies too costly for frequent use major loophole the general agreement tariffs and trade has been closed today senior official here commented reuter

offset pct qualifying development expenditure certain future oil fields against petroleum revenue tax prt date full relief was allowed for expenditure individual field itself when its income stream began but was not immediately available against other development expenditure the statement said the new relief will apply fields outside the southern basin for which development consent first given certain expenditure oil related research which does not present qualify for prt relief offset against prt liability this means oil related expenditure the the continental shelf which has not become allowable particular field within three years being incurred allowed against prt liability any oil field the inland revenue said this brings the scope prt relief for research costs more line with corporation tax relief measures and planned encourage general research into ways reducing field development costs said due course the industry should benefit over mln stg year calculated the inland revenue statement also included other technical measures that lawson did not comment his budget speech these included measures allow companies balance their shares prt exempt oil allowances through reallocation two past periods allowance utilisation tidier rules incorrectly allowed prt expenditure reliefs were announced while there were also ammendments rules corporation tax and advance corporation tax relating the called ring fence activities the and its continental shelf the finance bill will have provisions for the implementation measures announced november said gareth lewis chances that development smaller north sea fields such osprey don and arbroath would brought forward early development the larger miller and bruce oil fields might also encouraged said lewis davies said the measure might also aid the offshore construction industry which suffered huge amount lay offs under the price slump more than pct last year pointed out that the relief only applies the development new fields outside the southern basin this means more jobs could created the fields the central and northern sectors the north sea are deeper than the south and thus have greater capital crude	opec wants dlr oil price oapec official opec believes world oil prices should set around fixed average price dlrs barrel oapec assistant general secretary abdelaziz wattari said today speech european community oapec opec seminar luxembourg released here wattari said opec believes the world energy trade should kept without restrictions and should built around fixed average price dlrs but warned that defense the dlr barrel level had caused hardship for opec countries who had been forced curtail production and warned that such cutbacks opec states could not sustained some cases for opec stabilize the world oil price what now considered the optimal level dlrs barrel its member countries have had undergo severe hardship curtailing production wattari said such cutbacks cannot certain cases sustained wattari said well financial and marketing pressures some states depended associated gas output for domestic use and oil cutbacks had left insufficient gas supplies added wattari noted that total opec output was below the organization agreed ceiling for all member countries february although this had meant sacrifices the effect these sacrifices meant that market stability though restored good level was still under pressure wattari said lasting stability the world market requires wider scope international cooperation added said some non opec oil producing countries had shown political willingness after cooperate with opec but although cutbacks announced these states were politically significant and welcomed opec they were insufficient terms volume added the overall majority non opec producers have not responded sufficiently opec calls for supply regulation said wattari said dlr barrel price was optimal allowed investment the oil industry outside opec continue while not generating excessive cash flow for otherwise unviable high cost areas outside opec such price would longer encourage protectionist measures added fadhil chalabi opec deputy secretary general also addressing the seminar added that discipline was still needed prevent violent fluctuations the oil market cooperation between arab states and europe was advantageous for both sides chalabi said adding hoped cooperation would ultimately lead full fledged euro arab dialogue reuter

acq	economic spotlight japan buying overseas firms more and european firms will falling prey japanese corporations bulging with cash and eager extend their reach further overseas according merger and acquisitions specialists polled reuters already rich japanese companies have pounced banks steel and other businesses the latest attempt fujitsu ltd itsu japan biggest computer maker unsuccessfully bid for fairchild semiconductor corp microchip maker which supplies components for supercomputers nomura securities ltd nmsc and daiwa securities ltd dsec japan two largest brokerage firms are seeking niche the and european securities markets while the country huge banks are looking for strongholds overseas banking the takeover specialists said major trading houses which see their profits evaporating the heat increased competition merchandise trade all have foreign businesses their shopping lists among manufacturers car parts makers are under the most pressure buy overseas companies and follow the big auto makers they subcontract for these move offshore the timing favourable for japanese parties buy potential overseas businesses especially the japan largest market and where political risks are minimal takeover specialist one trading company said japanese companies have become among the world richest after series boom export years and the yen has climbed against the dollar some pct the past months but the yen strength which has also raised the costs japan exports and allowed its asian neighbours move into its traditional markets has frozen japanese corporate growth the specialists said looming trade friction also threatening erect more barriers against japanese exports japanese firms see overseas acquisitions way avoid the gloomy growth outlook and put their excess cash work domestic interest rates now record lows offer little investment opportunity japanese interest acquisitions has been continuous but the recent economic factors have become driving force said banking industry source far though the japanese are being cautious while mergers and acquisitions among firms number the thousands japanese buyouts overseas companies have totalled just few dozen one merchant banker said another merchant banker said that flurry japanese acquisition activity was originally expected five years from now but that time span appeared now too long japanese firms are becoming more aggressive now said turning point seemed dainippon ink and chemicals inc diac takeover bid for sun chemical corp the last year which some analysts saw somewhat hostile added dainippon ink bought sun chemical graphic arts group for mln dlrs late last year after earlier unsolicited bid for the whole company sun chemical refused sell its entire business after learning that dainippon planned liquidate all but its graphic arts related businesses hostile takeovers are considered unethical and frowned upon the japanese the trading company official says japanese people don like fighting they prefer peaceful amicable deals but now after some experience overseas japanese companies are acquainted with local practice adds this healthy progression however the experts not expect the japanese run the board meetings any giant european concerns japanese companies are not fully confident managing large european corporation one banker said they will expand their operations only gradually typical way for japanese business foreign merchant banker also noted there are not many mega deals left the united states lot the big deals there have already been done but medium size and small concerns are potential targets japanese companies the specialists said japanese will aiming for new businesses high technology areas japanese companies had used technology and quality get where they are and are unlikely deviate from that trend one takeover specialist said many are watching the results the first acquisitions these succeed activity could build the specialists said but few such specialists are going sit back and wait until the action begins already they said japanese trading houses long term credit and commercial banks brokerages and foreign merchant banks have set research sections act betweens deals find good buys for themselves reuter

ship	economic spotlight japan shipbuilders recovery japan ailing shipbuilding industry plans refloat itself few years from the twin rocks recession and strong yen through capacity and workforce cuts and greater use computers industry sources told reuters the salvage measures which include government sponsored rationalisation program are aimed clawing back some the market which japan the world leader has lost south korea through currency and labour cost disadvantages they said the sources said south korea yards are now some pct more competitive than japan due such factors the government plans help the industry shed pct current capacity within two years through mergers and regrouping under legislation put before parliament this month and likely approved may june the sources said they said from september semi government body will assure repayment about billion yen liabilities incurred through job losses and the sale excess capacity and another billion for buying unneeded land and equipment last friday the shipbuilders association japan applied the fair trade commission form cartel slash tonnage built about half total capacity for year from april the commission has held several hearings with the industry and approval should given this month the sources said clampdown output over one two years combined with planned cost cutting and streamlining program and state support should help japanese yards recover their international competitiveness they said under the cartel proposals yards each capable building ships more than gross tonnes would build maximum three mln compensated gross registered tonnes cgrt this about half total capacity this will ease the cut throat competition which forced most yards sign orders below cost the sources said the industry likely seek renew the cartel for the transport ministry sees new orders falling mln cgrt from mln they said the rationalisation program includes cut the estimated workers the industry between and japanese yards topped world order books end december followed south korea and taiwan according lloyd register shipping however falling orders and declining international competitiveness due the strong yen led heavy losses the industry the sources said four japan six major heavy machinery and shipbuilding companies reported current deficits the first half the year march and five them are expected report current deficits for the whole they said the shipbuilding companies streamlining program will raise productivity compete with south korean yards which have also been hard hit declining orders and low ship prices recnt years the sources said japan single yard leads the industry resulting fierce competition and slow progress reducing capacity the two largest firms mitsubishi heavy industries ltd mith and ishikawajima harima heavy industries ltd jima account for only pct ships built the sources said world shipowners hope japanese yards can manage ride out the recession their technology the best the world said official major japanese shipping company the japanese merchant fleet the largest after liberia has intention shifting other countries buy ships and this will encourage japanese yards the sources said reuter

trade	warns congress new trade bill the european community has warned the house representatives that tough trade legislation considering could prompt retaliation trading partners the warning was sent letter from sir roy denman head the delegation washington dan rostenkowski chairman the house ways and means committee copy the letter was made available reuters denman told rostenkowski illinois democrat backed aspects the bill such one backing new talks under the gatt and one excluding protection for the textile industry but denman disagreed with other provisions which would require president reagan take retaliatory trade action against nations with large trade surpluses with the and would set new standards for judging unfair foreign trade practices denman told rostenkowski that gatt regulations prohibit member nations from taking unilateral retaliatory action trade disputes unless the action gatt approved said the congress makes retaliatory action mandatory then the united states would violation its international legal obligations and collision course with its major trading partners denman added that president should have flexibility enforcing trade laws saying the last resort any administration must take its decision light the overall national interest otherwise said the risk would counter reaction trading partners the united states retaliation enactment mirror image legislation employed against imports from the united states denman also said congress could prompt retaliation reduced the threshhold unfair trade making easier for firms file unfair trade practice claims retaliation could also prompted relaxing standards for findings that imports were injuring firms changes these standards must agreed upon multilaterally they cannot imposed the united states alone the world trading system said house leaders have rejected plan textile state legislators add the trade bill provision curb imports cloth and clothing similar measure passed two years ago but vetoed president reagan there was concern the leaders that reagan would veto the entire trade bill because the textile amendment reuter

crude	economic spotlight saudi arabia reshapes economy higher world oil prices coupled with new realism ushered austerity could lift saudi arabia economy after five years falling revenue and growing budget deficits bankers and diplomats said the months ahead will prove critical the government attempts balancing act between defending higher oil prices and fostering recovery through bigger role for the private sector economists said oil earnings could recover this year about billion dlrs and nominal gross domestic product could grow about three pct the first rise since but the economists said this will possible only the organisation petroleum exporting countries opec succeeds defending world oil prices and saudi arabia not forced curtail output for too long saudi arabia now keeping production down defend opec newly established dlr barrel benchmark price oil minister hisham nazer told reuters output running about three mln barrels per day bpd well down saudi arabia opec quota mln set for the first half king fahd has stamped his personal authority opec new found determination defend prices move western diplomats believe underlines the kingdom need secure stable source income for its economy saudi arabia still the world largest oil exporter hugely wealthy country but the past five years declining revenue have taken their toll economists estimate gross domestic product fell pct last year and pct oil revenue last year when prices briefly dipped below dlrs per barrel probably totalled more than billion dlrs compared peak billion austerity still the watchword but saudi arabia will not allowed dip further into recession the saudis can afford draw down reserves temporarily offset the worst effects diplomat said the short term the kingdom can lessen the impact lower oil revenues and gaping budget deficit drawing foreign reserves still put around billion dlrs but such policy cannot pursued indefinitely bankers and diplomats said would amount fiscal recklessness the longer term also increases the dominance the public sector time when the government publicly urging private enterprise take over the lead role the economy bankers and diplomats said the government well aware the risks attached this policy but determined tough out the oil front even that means short term depletion reserves the budget deficit targetted huge billion riyals pct total outlay the budget explicitly recognises the need draw down reserves while foreign borrowing has been ruled out commerce minister suleiman abdulaziz salim told saudi businessmen this week the government had carefully considered the need stimulate the economy when drawing its budget plans late last year therefore took the bold step withdrawing more than billion riyals from its reserves and pumping into the economy said reserves were built during the late and early when saudi arabia breakneck pace construction and tales high spending became legendary the shrinking economy has wrought huge changes the fabric the kingdom private sector where poor management had gone unpunished the easy days the oil boom modern techniques cost control have been introduced markets expanded and outsized labour forces and inventories cut back the expatriate workforce has fallen sharply the number new bankruptcies appears declining but saudi banks hit hard non performing loans the corporate sector have become highly selective extending new credit government moves encourage lending and investigate company complaints about late public sector contract payments could boost confidence but recession has slowed the nation industrialisation program and discouraged foreign investment private wealth still very high and banks report more and more cash being placed deposit saudi arabia attempts shift the weight economic development from the public the private sector one the biggest tasks will convince businessmen channel personal savings into industrial projects within the kingdom and refrain from the temptation invest abroad reuter

interest	german banks see low interest rates continuing the association german cooperative banks said financial survey that domestic interest rates would continue remain low for the time being said the bundesbank could hold them down despite strong foreign influence and saw interest straining factors the economy that could affect the long term capital market the inflation rate one pct also gave occasion for higher nominal interest rates but probable rise inflation late this year could give very slight grounds for rise nominal rates year end and next year said the association said generally low interest rates prospects lower taxes stable dollar rate and expected strong domestic demand led believe that the investment climate would remain friendly and the economy would continue its slow but very sure growth the bundesbank had managed successfully keep interest rates down the short term money market although its policies had exerted little effect the long term capital market which was important for investment financing and thus for the course the economy said view the limits the possibilities monetary policy had influencing the longer term capital market the association saw little sense wanting boost the economy through short term and expansionist monetary policy the other hand also saw reason for sticking dogmatically the money supply target for the whole the association said time would show what extent speculative foreign money and short term invested domestic money would distort money supply developments the bundesbank could hold down money market rates with the highly effective instrument sale and repurchase transactions said reuter

money-fx	bank finland trade banks certificates the bank finland said has started dealings banks certificates deposits cds with immediate effect and that was prepared issue its own paper stimulate operations the domestic money market bank finland governor rolf kullberg told news conference the bank will also limit credits the call money market from march introducing maximum credit amount and penalty rate banks exceed this ceiling the recent introduction three month money and these new regulations are decreasing the role the call money market and the discount rate monetary instruments kullberg said bankers welcomed the central bank measures saying these were needed accelerate the domestic money market the bank finland had never before been allowed issue its own cds they said the central bank for the first time has instrument with which really can influence the price money this country one banker said under the new rules banks are limited call money credits maximum pct the total their equity capital and cash reserves penalty rate interest pct now introduced the limit exceeded director sixten korkman the bank finland monetary department said expected the bank pursue active policy the interbank market issuer own cds are free maybe monday will issue the first just see how the system functions overall think will issue least few times week korkman told reuters said the bank was likely aim cds with three month maturity first the market was best developed for paper that maturity the bank finland introduced last december three month credits and deposits rates determined the central bank and the commercial banks shift away from the traditional overnight call money market liquidity the call credit market has fallen from around nine billion markka early december mln last week while three month credits have risen three four billion the interbank market there has been increasing trade banks cds estimated some eight billion markka addition commercial paper accounts for around five billion markka and treasury bills two billion reuter

has decided within the next months clark told the commonwealth club california have fast track authority from your congress for approval rejection whatever the negotiators achieve clark said that practical matter initial agreement must reached late september early october listed environmental questions particularly acid rain and defense the second and third most important bilateral issues facing ottawa and washington wednesday president reagan announced that will seek billion dlrs from congress address the acid rain problem some interpreted the move goodwill gesture advance his annual meeting april ottawa with prime minister brian mulroney question and answer session with the public affairs group clark said that the two countries must find better mechanisms for resolving their trade disputes this rash countervailing actions where acted corn and you acted soft wood and both said they were quasijudicial the dispute resolution mechanisims place now are not working adequately either our interests said ottawa also seeking change some washington rules government procurement that penalize canadian businesses said there are number canadian companies that order secure substantial contracts the united states have had move their head offices out our country into your country because you have national procurement requirements said turn added the united states would like change some the procurement requirements that exist the provincial government level canada clark declined forecast the outcome the discussions what will come out remains for the negotiators the first instance propose and then governments and congresses will have judge said his prepared remarks clark said that the united states has tended take canada for granted although exports its northern money-fx	nigeria changes auction rules defend the naira nigeria central bank has changed the rules governing its foreign exchange auctions what analysts see means defending the naira currency which has depreciated steadily the bank said statement that from april banks bidding for foreign exchange would have pay the rate they offered and not presently the rate the lowest successful bid made the auction this should discourage banks from bidding high ensure that they were successful while paying the lower marginal rate analysts said should act brake because banks will know that they bid high they will have pay what they offered western diplomat commented the naira has depreciated against the dollar pct since the auctions known the second tier foreign exchange market sfem began last september last week session the nigerian currency was fixed the dollar the third fall row they were clearly worried and this the logical way trying stop the trend the diplomat said the central bank also announced the auctions would fortnightly not weekly beginning april was not immediately clear whether next thursday scheduled session would still take place nor the bank was planning double the mln dlrs which are normally offer each auction demand for foreign exchange has consistently outstripped supply encouraging banks bid high and thus further weakening the naira the normal weekly allocation not doubled the fortnightly session high demand could undermine the objective the new system analysts said although bidding banks will now pay what they offered the official exchange rate for the naira applying business transactions will continue the marginal rate the lowest successful bid sfem central part nigeria structural adjustment program which considered the most ambitious economic recovery plan black africa the program involves setting realistic exchange rate for the naira which was over valued for many years liberalising imports boosting agriculture removing subsidies and reducing inefficient government participation the economy the world bank has played prominent part designing this dramatic blue print and selling often sceptical public which fears inflation and lower living standards ishrat husain the world bank representative nigeria said yesterday was satisfied both with the adjustment program whole and the foreign exchange auctions far good told meeting bankers lagos adding that only members nigeria import dependent elite would suffer hardship while the common man would benefit fears that the program would encourage inflation were incorrect said bumper harvests had reduced rural inflation and urban prices had already reflected the naira black market value before the currency was allowed find its true level last september reuter

trade	canada outlines gatt agricultural reform plan canadian trade minister pat carney said that agricultural policies should not hurt world international trade and should therefore become more price responsive over time she told delegates the informal meeting trade ministers that this was one five principles canada wanted adopted reforming agriculture the general agreement tariffs and trade gatt secondly support for agriculture should avoid production incentives and thirdly countries should freeze and seek reduce government aid measures that distorted world prices carney said carney said the fourth principle was that countries should not introduce new import barriers not mandated existing legislation and the fifth was that these basic principles must implemented collectively carney later told reuters the canadian guidelines are basically compatible with the seven point australian proposals announced davos switzerland january european trade sources said the conference welcomed the canadian initiative but some delegates and not only the european community voiced reservations about some the principles carney said there was lot political will among the ministers here complete the uruguay round gatt under four years and that there also realisation that has done balanced way the consensus view was proceed fast can broad front and see what areas emerge where can get early conclusion she said however the meeting did not identify what those areas are carney said she said canada bilateral trade negotiations which must concluded least draft form october are progressing well reuter

trade	indonesia urged deregulate its economy world bank president barber conable linked increased borrowing indonesia the third world sixth largest debtor fresh measures deregulate trade and dismantle protectionist barriers would like see the indonesian government continue the adjustment process move towards increased deregulation the economy conable told press conference the end three day visit jakarta conable directly linked further bank help for indonesia hard pressed balance payments further measures the government reduce protectionism and increase efficiency the world bank last month granted indonesia mln dlr trade adjustment loan said further loans would depend the economic policies indonesia adopted but said that meetings with both president suharto and leading indonesian ministers had not called for specific policy changes the initiative will have rest with the indonesian government are not here dictate them stated indonesia the only asian member opec has been badly hit last year slump oil prices which cut its revenues from crude exports half conable had what termed frank meeting this morning with suharto voiced support for measures already taken including september pct devaluation the rupiah and efforts deregulate imports and stimulate exports the government can rely the support the world bank continuing program adjustment the economic realities today world said the bank has loaned indonesia billion dlrs over the past years lending now about one billion year the world bank would probably like see further dismantling tarrif barriers and measures reduce indonesia protected monopolies areas like steel plastics and cement western bankers and diplomats said the government has already said will announce further deregulation measures but has given money-fx	exchange rates almost within levels sumita bank japan governor satoshi sumita said that current exchange rates are almost within the levels agreed six major nations last month paris asked whether dollar yen rate reflected economic fundamentals said current rates almost reflect fundamentals sumita told reporters major nations have cooperated bring about currency stability line with the paris agreement which stipulated that they would closely cooperate that end repeated the central bank will intervene necessary adding did not think dollar free fall was likely but sumita said could not say exactly what currency levels would considered line with underlying economic fundamentals paris february britain canada france japan the and west germany agreed cooperate hold currencies around their then current levels sumita said could not find any specific reasons behind the fall the dollar record low against the yen yesterday but said the market rushed sell dollars nervously reacted statements abroad and developments surrounding trade tensions treasury secretary james baker said over the weekend that the paris pact did not encompass fixed tragets for the dollar trade representative clayton yeutter called japan relations certain key trade issues very strained the market reacted nervously because the dollar has been moving narrowly against the yen since mid january sumita said added does not expect the yen dollar exchange rate remain unstable because the market concerned about sharp rise the yen the bank japan will keep close watch exchange rates line with the paris accord added reuter
