crude	canada sets oil industry aid package canada federal government will provide mln dlr oil industry aid package that includes cash incentives designed cover one third company oil and gas exploration and development costs energy minister marcel masse announced the aid program will inject about mln dlrs year into the oil and gas industry and could lead more than one billion dlrs new investment masse told news conference the program will affect drilling done anywhere canada after april masse told reporters that the government oil industry aid package aimed small and medium sized companies the aid package called the canadian exploration and development incentive program will restrict the total payments that any individual company can claim mln dlrs year masse said the program will probably generate new employment equivalent people working for year said oil industry aid needed because exploration and development spending dropped least pct since world oil prices fell during the first half energy minister masse said the federal government decided provide cash incentives large number non tax paying companies mainly small canadian firms will receive the full value the incentive such companies would not immediately benefit from tax benefits said the federal government also wanted deliver aid program outside the tax system finance minister michael wilson now reviewing canada tax system and plans announce tax reform proposals later this spring important feature the aid program decision let companies issue flow through shares allowing investors benefit from the subsidy rather than restricting benefits only participating companies said allowing flow through shares under the program will make easier for companies attract investors exploration and development masse said told reporters his department still considering whether allow partnerships and other entities qualify for the subsidy reuter

the current dollar selling not sheer speculative nature but backed real demand said koichi miyazaki deputy general manager sanwa bank dealers said the dollar will remain weak despite the intervention money-fx	german wage round said limit monetary options the bundesbank options for west germany monetary policy are limited for the foreseeable future the delicate stage wage negotiations between unions and employers economists and money market dealers said call money fell quite active trading today dropping pct from pct yesterday and below the pct treasury bill rate difficult month end approached but dealers and economists said the bundesbank was unlikely encourage lower rates the foreseeable future largely for fear upsetting the current wage round one money market dealer for major foreign bank said don think the bundesbank wants rates whatever happens but also does not want them fall above all wants wait see how the unions wage round goes west germany unions and employers prepare the ground for triennial wage negotiations based detailed assessments growth and inflation economists said ute geipel economist with citibank said the bundesbank became more accommodating monetary policy raising fears some quarters return inflation the medium term unions would obliged curtail wage demands result the bundesbank was concerned make move that would interfere the negotiating process geipel said the current round the country most powerful union the metall representing metalworkers and engineers demanding shortening the working week hours from the present and accompanying five pct increase wages the engineering employers association gesamtmetall offering bring hour week from july and give two stage wage increase pct rise from april this year and another pct from july the agreement forged metall europe largest union with mln members and the employers would set the benchmark for settlements other industries such the public sector banks and federal post office negotiations began december and unions are hopeful they may conclude early april ahead the traditional holiday period june though many economists said the unions current warning strikes and rhetoric were part the negotiating strategy and would not lead repeat damaging seven week strikes others said unions would not compromise greatly their positions and there could still conflict this could extend the length time which the bundesbank would keep its activity low key economists said the money market head said the unions humiliation the protracted financial problems the neue heimat cooperative housing venture would contribute union obstinacy the unions haven forgotten that and they will put this squarely onto the account the negotiations said addition the newly elected chairman the metall union franz steinkuehler was more radical and determined than his predecessor hans meyer and may set for longer battle achieve the best possible settlement for his membership more than engineering workers firms mainly south germany held warning strikes lasting two hours yesterday firms hit included zahnradfabrik passau gmbh and aerospace group messerschmitt boelkow blohm gmbh today employees from companies came out warning strikes statement from metall said money market dealers said that overnight call money rates would rise the near future any case and did not depend politically inhibited bundesbank about eight billion marks were coming into the market tomorrow from salary payments the federal government result some banks fell back the bundesbank offer mop liquidity via the sale three day treasury bills anticipating still lower rates before the month end but pension payment date banks behalf customers was due monday other dealers noted banks were short trade	gatt warns federal budget protectionism the united states emphasis its foreign trade deficit misplaced and the country real problem lies its large federal budget deficit the general agreeement tariffs and trade gatt said stressing its record trade deficit billion dlrs last year the was fuelling protectionist pressure which threatens the world trading system said annual report the fundamental problem the size the federal budget deficit could remedied only cutting government spending encouraging personal savings finance the debt said gatt also predicted world trade would grow only pct full percentage point lower than each the previous two years gatt experts urged washington resist protectionism and instead seek macroeconomic changes reduce the current account payments deficit higher private savings lower investment and smaller federal budget deficit raising trade barriers would result little reduction the current account deficit would however increase inflation and reduce world trade said the basic cause some combination insufficient domestic savings and excessive budget deficit would remain the report said gatt economists said trade expansion would slow this year because slower growth forecasts japan and some west european nations they adjust production and workforces low dollar risk higher inflation concerns over third world debt management and looming protectionism the report also said imbalances the current accounts japan west germany and the had increased the most likely explanation was that exchange rate changes were not backed changes macroeconomic policies added thus the prediction that these imbalances would reduced result the major realignment exchange rates was not borne out last year the report said gatt warned there was risk sizeable increase the inflation rate under the combined impact rapidly expanding money supply and low dollar such development could worsen the business climate increasing uncertainty and pushing interest rates which turn would adversely affect world trade but the report noted surprising rise imports the united states despite the dollar depreciation which makes foreign products more expensive suggested that resources idle the both human and underutilised factories were not geared produce the goods and services sought from abroad world trade manufactures grew only three pct about half the rate the previous year trade agricultural goods expanded just one pct continuing stagnant pattern that sector this decade gatt said developing countries exports declined significantly while their imports increased moderately although full statistics are not available yet gatt said the combined export earnings major indebted nations were sharply lower and only five them chile colombia philippines south korea and thailand had higher exports reuter

trade	india steps countertrade deals cut trade gap india searching for non communist countertrade partners help cut its trade deficit and conserve foreign exchange wheat tobacco tea coffee jute engineering and electronic goods well minerals including iron ore are all offer return for crude oil petroleum products chemicals steel and machinery trade sources told reuters most the impetus behind countertrade which began comes from two state trading firms the state trading corp stc and the minerals and metals trading corp mmtc the two state trading corporations are free use their buying power respect bulk commodities promote indian exports commerce ministry spokeswoman said adding that private firms are excluded from countertrading one trade source said india has targetted countries that depend indian domestic market recently opened foreign imports however countertrade deals still make only small part india total trading and are likely account for less than eight pct the estimated billion dlrs trade during the nine months ended december the sources said countertrade accounted for just five pct india billion dlrs trade during fiscal ended march against almost nothing official figures show however the figures exclude exchanges with the eastern bloc paid non convertible indian rupees the sources said total trade with the soviet union involving swaps agricultural produce and textiles for soviet arms and crude oil estimated billion dlrs fiscal against three billion indian countertrade which being promoted mainly help narrow the country large trade deficit still insignificant compared with agreements reached indonesia venezuela and brazil the trade sources said the trade deficit which hit estimated record billion dlrs expected decline billion the current fiscal year but the push include non communist countries countertrade also due other factors including the slow growth foreign reserves tight debt repayment schedule shrinking aid and trade protectionism businessmen said one source said india showing more dynamism promoting countertrade deals than the past when the deals were made discreetly because they break gatt rules member the general agreement tariffs and trade gatt india cannot officially support bartering the mmtc recent countertrade deals include iron ore exports yugoslavia for steel structures and rails mmtc recent global tenders now include clause that preference will given parties who accept payment kind for goods and services sold india trade official said adding that the policy remains flexible also take into account other factors such prices which the goods and services are offered india the trade official said early this year the commerce ministry quietly told foreign companies interested selling aircraft ships drilling rigs and railway equipment india that they stood better chance they bought indian goods services return the trade sources said illustrating the point the official said south earn	galactic galcf adopts conservative accounting galactic resources ltd earlier reporting loss mln dlrs said adopted more conservative accounting policy similar other gold producers accounting for exploration costs result the company retroactively charged all past exploration and related administration costs incurred its properties against expenses and under the new policy all future exploration and related administration costs will written off expenses rather than capitalized intangible asset said galactic said the accounting change resulted mln dlr charge against earnings did not immediately disclose the affect the change prior years results the new accounting policy not expected adversely affect working capital position future cash flows the company ability conduct ongoing business operations said galactic said the charge includes mln dlrs costs concerning its summitville mine leach pad and mln dlrs waste removal costs dyke construction and other mine developments galactic said under the prior accounting policy the summitville mine expenses would have been amortized over the life the mine and charged against future earnings the change will also result lower depreciation and amortization charges against income about dlrs ounce gold produced future periods based total estimated reserves ounces galactic said march leaching production summitville expected exceed ounces raising gold equivalent production since the june start leaching ounces reuter

money-fx	bahrain introduces new money market regime bahrain introducing new domestic money market regime provide dinar liquidity aid centred the island newly launched treasury bill programme the bahrain monetary agency has issued circular all commercial banks outlining new policy from april which gives liquidity aid through sale and repurchase agreements treasury bills through discounting them the circular released officially reuters said current arrangements for providing liquidity aid will longer valid except quite exceptional circumstances under the current system the agency provides the island commercial banks with dinar liquidity means short term swaps against dollars and less frequently short term loans secured against government development bonds the agency considers that now appropriate replace these operations with short term assistance based government bahrain treasury bills the circular banks states the agency said will repurchase treasury bills with simultaneous agreement resell them the same bank higher price which will reflect interest charge the agency said envisages the repurchase agreements will normally for period seven days bahrain launched weekly tender for two mln dinars day treasury bills mid december last year and has since raised total mln dinars through the programme bahrain commercial banks are currently liquid and have been making little use the traditional dollar swaps offered the agency but banking sources said the new regime from april will mean banks cannot afford not hold treasury bills case they need funds from the central bank banking sources said more than half the banks hold treasury bills although the need others take paper could increase demand weekly tenders and push down allotted yields slightly last week yield was six pct although the programme had started the end last year with rates low pct banking sources said the cost liquidity through repurchase accords will not differ much from that dollar swaps but bank using dollars obtain liquidity would foresake interest the currency while the underlying treasury bill investment unaffected repurchase accord reuter

flowed back into the market today the bulk would not return until tomorrow the start the new month dealers said dealers said the large banks which they did not name commanded short term money requirements much five billion marks with knowledge their own needs until the end the month the banks bought excessive amounts treasury bills draining liquidity for three days when other banks sought funds rates rose and large banks were able place excess funds deposit considerably higher average return one senior dealer said the bundesbank with advanced knowledge the market needs should have anticipate the strength demand for funds the following day said bundesbank dealers could easily have said are not selling any treasury bills not selling them this amount said the bundesbank wants finely steer the market then they should avoid such excesses tomorrow will different call money will fall back pct but the bundesbank would not approve the sharp jump rates given the delicate state trade	trade war fears may prompt stock markets downturn the threatened trade war between the united states and japan just the kind shock that economists say could send world stock markets into tailspin but they are not sure that would brief corrective dip whether this week falling share prices mark the start bear market the billion dollar question said richard brien economist american express international bank london japan trade surplus billion dlrs last year has poured into share and bond markets around the world and funded good chunk the huge budget deficit around third any new sale treasury bonds has been bought the japanese however japanese investors have lost money the dollar falls and will lose more the united states lets fall further cut the trade deficit the counterpart improving the trade deficit either through lower dollar because the increases duties japanese electronic goods may hit the capital inflow which has financed the budget deficit and the trade deficit does fall the japanese will have less money invest entice investors fill the gap that would left the japanese stopped buying bonds interest rates would have soar brien said the subsequent shift from shares bonds could cause major falls the world stock markets year ago could pretty confident about the markets said brien now much less certain buoyant share prices are supposed reflect booming economy but the world economy with sluggish growth best the industrial nations massive load third world debt and huge trade imbalances not good shape said brien nevertheless new york analyst william raferty smith barney harris upham said still bull market adding that corrections are normal part rising market and the bear usually strikes slowly economist evelyn brody morgan grenfell and london said the huge sums money going through the world financial system will keep floor under share and bond prices although interest the japanese putting their money non dollar denominated bonds and stocks has increased very difficult see where else they can put their money than dollars and especially the treasury bond market according david butcher senior executive yamaichi securities ltd bond operation london said the japanese are paying much closer attention now the french franc and west german mark the longer run worries about what trade tensions and the dollar slide will mean for securities markets reuter

less than percentage points there strong chance prime rate increase has been under points recently however banks are likely hold rate increases until they see what the fed intends about interest rates the near term analysts said they noted that banks historically like follow fed rate movements rather than lead them for example the last prime rate increase occurred june when banks lifted the rate pct from pct after fed discount rate increase april that year major banks had been posting pct prime rate since last august when they lowered the rate from eight pct shortly after the fed half point money-fx	fed explores commodity basket index the complex task wielding control over monetary policy increasingly fast moving global economy could aided tying policy commodity prices the newest member the federal reserve board says commodity prices are already considered the fed the making monetary policy but they would given much greater role under idea being floated governor robert heller who joined the board last august conceeds that much more study the idea needed but argues that such arrangement particularly were adopted other major industrial countries could reduce the volatility exchange rates moreover could help stabilize the prices commodities themselves slowing changes inflation his idea which many conservative economists find appealing has some backing among board members appointed recent years president reagan would complement the present system opening closing the monetary screws based the pattern inflation key indicators such unemployment and the rise fall the money supply changes the money supply can lead changes interest rates and affect economic activity directly discussed and off for long time the commodity concept part growing search for system that anchors monetary policy and widely fluxtuating currency prices more solid base what needed anchor reference point that can serve guide for both domestic and international monetary purposes says heller the past this anchor was gold but the united states went off the gold standard because the global economy had vastly outstripped gold supplies return the gold standard generally dismissed out hand most policymakers the grounds that the largest producers gold are the soviet union and south africa the called fixed rate system scuttled the early still considered unworkable the present world but the current system floating currencies which currencies can fluxtuate widely adding vast pressures the monetary system also being widely questioned some have suggested that the system might benefit from formal approach that mandates intervention countries when currencies wander above below agreed levels but there are major problems with this also for one thing there justifiable concern that countries might relunctant intervene they felt might detrimental their own domestic economy moreover some question whether concerted intervention can make much inpact the overall market does not agree with the fundamental judgement the poorest countries have called for monetary conference work out new system that not surprisingly helps them cope with their overpowering debt problems treasury secretary james baker the reagan administration chief economic architect has preferred use the called group five industrial countries sometimes seven forum work out cooperative agreements currency and other economic matters appears convinced that officials from west germany france britain japan italy and canada talking quietly behind closed doors can reached reasoned decisions away from public posturing the heller approach while extremely complex could have profound impact the system ideally stabalizing prices and international exchange rates envisioned heller basket say major commodities ranging from wheat oil would put together and prices would measured regular basis times rising commodity prices monetary policy might tightened and times falling commodity prices montary policy might eased says notes that commodity prices are traded daily auction markets and commodity price index can calculated virtually continuous basis moreover most commodity prices are produced consumed and traded world wide basis that index has relevance for the entire world says addition commodity prices are the beginning the production chain and serve imput into virtually all production processes focusing commodity prices early and sensitive indicator current and perhaps also future prices pressures the monetary authorities may take such index into account making their monetary policy decisions says however says that any major change basic commodity such occurred oil during the because action the opec cartel would have discounted such system says the worst thing that could happen allow monetary policy spread freakish increase one commodity the rest the system and other commodities reuter

grain	economic spotlight china must preserve farmland using farmland have done since there will none left years grow grain jinfeng middle aged official fengbang village the edge shanghai sums the dilemma china faces tries feed its more than one billion people and the same time let them get richer building factories and new homes china has feed one quarter the world population but only one seventh its land arable sharp increases farm output since turned china into net grain exporter for the first time and again but the rapid industrialisation the countryside which has occurred the same time has gobbled arable land for factories and homes for peasants who can now afford them official figures show that china lost just under one pct its arable land other uses and slightly smaller amount last year gained mln new mouths feed during the two years lost very little land prior when the industrialisation began official said since then nearly all the families the county have built new homes and many factories have gone last year lost land new railway line said but land losses future should fall because nearly all families already have new houses she added the issue land loss matter major concern the peking leadership which announced earlier this month that china will issue nationwide quotas for conversion grain land for the first time this year the present situation abusing occupying unlawfully wasting and destroying land and land resources serious said article the official press explaining the new measures has resulted great losses cultivated farmland said china has large population and its land resources are badly deficient official the shanghai city government said county authorities could approve conversion only hectares arable land other uses while anything more than that must approved the city government the peking government faces another major obstacle its efforts ensure china people get enough grain eat the prices the state pays farmers for grain are too low making more profitable for them grow other crops offset this the state offers farmers cheap fertiliser and diesel oil and payment advance for grain contracts buy the state then sells the grain subsidised prices china mln city residents rural factories also subsidise grain output paying farmers bonuses grow some officials argue that the simplest solution the problem would for the state raise city grain prices chen zuyuan communist party secretary village the eastern province zhejiang said the government listened too much the demands selfish city people and could raise city grain prices without any problem but the government has ruled out price rise raising the price grain would directly conflict with the goal social stability said china daily editorial this month the shanghai official said prices must reformed over the long term must very careful have very large population which used price stability and will object price rises said the problem how the shanghai official said rise grain prices might also affect the prices hundreds food products made with grain and consumed city residents addition the state faces the problem inadequate investment farmers land and grain particular the official press has reported that farmers fear farm policy may change and they are putting their new wealth into building graves memorial halls for ancestors and homes under reforms introduced the late farmers sign contracts with the state requiring them grow certain crops but they have considerable freedom how use their land the expiration date the year contract almost the halfway mark farmers are beginning worry about the future the china daily said editorial last month their anxieties stem from the fact that they are allowed use the land but not own for most the period communist rule the land was organised into collectives where there was little room for individual initiative new measures are needed reassure them the consistency government policies and make weeks the year and the interest margin was squeezed further the weak german bourse saw earnings commission fall sharply and trading securities also fell but earnings from currency dealing were still satisfactory told news conference deutsche group partial operating profits rose billion marks from billion balance sheet billion marks after billion profits were swollen earnings from the placement the former flick group which have been estimated some one billion marks and from record profits trading the bank own account not included partial operating profits earnings from the flick transaction were booked through subsidiary and therefore showed part the interest surplus section current earnings from securities and participations the group this nearly doubled billion marks from billion usual the bank did not detail total operating profits but said that total operating profits including own account trading rose pct pct without the flick transaction the group and pct seven pct the parent bank banking analysts said this put group total operating profits some seven billion marks and parent bank operating profits over five billion marks christians said deutsche used the extraordinary earnings from flick pay record five mark bonus top its unchanged mark dividend the bank had decided against raising the dividend itself because the uncertain business outlook the end and developments far this year showed that was correct christians said west german banks rarely raise dividends unless they are sure they can maintain the increased payout subsequent years preferring use bonuses for one profits the bank also used its extraordinary earnings continue high level risk provision christians said disclosed group risk provisions rose mln marks from mln under german law disclosed provisions not necessarily reflect the full amount risk provisions management board joint spokesman alfred herrhausen said deutsche total debt exposure problem countries had fallen over six billion determine future developments stoltenberg declined comment specifically what would consider undervalued dollar but said dollar around marks created problems for west germany exports stoltenberg said studies international organisations had made clear that especially the and japan major efforts remained necessary support adjustments foreign trade balances via necessary corrections economic policy one would benefit after years over valuation the dollar fell into the other extreme that strong under valuation said stoltenberg said west germany had keen interest swift agreement between the and japan concerning the current trade dispute over semi conductors asked whether believed the markets would test the paris currency accord stoltenberg did not comment specifically but noted that much what had been discussed paris had not been published the paris declaration did not state the levels which central banks the major industrialised countries would intervene stoltenberg said that everything had been carefully considered said had nothing further add stoltenberg also appeared suggest that west germany was now longer under any pressure from the government stimulate its economy declined respond specifically question this subject but said you must attach particular importance the consensus which was reached paris the minister nevertheless added that would make clear during his trip washington that west germany nominal trade figures gave false impression about actual trade flows stoltenberg noted that bonn exports fell nominal two pct while its nominal imports fell pct west germany imports dropped largely because foreign currency developments and the cheaper price oil and led record trade surplus last year however stoltenberg said that real terms west germany exports volume had increased pct while real imports had risen much stronger pct this way west germany had made its contribution economic stability stoltenberg added stoltenberg noted the government expected imports rise real four five pct with exports stagnating said was too early revise official forecasts for west germany economic growth this year the government has forecast unchanged pct rise throughout the industrial world but interview with reuters conable said the action the united states slap tariffs certain electronic goods from japan did not mean the countries were heading for full scale trade war conable said the world bank has been pressing developing countries open their markets arguing that free trading environment increased the possibility global economic growth have fact been making adjustment loans many countries the developing world which have encouraged the opening their markets and want sure that the developed world doesn close the same time said said the action against japan was significant retaliatory step but did not constitute basic change trade policy the interview came just before next week semi annual meetings the bank and the international monetary fund referring brazil recent interest payments moratorium conable also said the global debt situation was very serious and must closely watched said the bank which the past has concentrated making loans that assist the basic underpinnings the developing world such dams roads and sewers will increasingly make assistance available for economic reform the bank has increased these loans part because the debt crisis that has found countries desperately need new funds for balance payments adjustment and economic reforms aimed opening their markets encouraging foreign investment and reducing government role the economy comfortable with adjustment lending expect however that will never reach majority our portfolio conable said made clear however that adjustment lending would continue increase proportion overall bank lending for some time noted the problem debt was severe one and many countries are asking for adjustment assistance because the problem debt conable former republican congressman from new york chosen president reagan for the bank position last year associate treasury secertary james baker who launched the strategy for shoring indebted nations october which included call for increased adjustment lending the world bank conable also said that expected the result major study the bank organization completed the next several weeks said the decision seek reorganization was based part the fact that the bank had come under fire from the poorest countries for not doing enough help and from the richest countries because inefficiency the reorganization considered major initiative conable and being closely watched the agency member countries indication his management style and priorities want sure this institution viewed those who must support soundly constituted that will permitted grow conable said however said don believe there anything basically wrong with this institution and don believe has have any redefinition its purpose said however that was apparent that the debt initiative proposed baker has given the bank central role dealing with the debt crisis conable added that cooperation between the bank and its sister agency the international monetary acq	sec clarifies position tender offer changes the securities and exchange commission reminded corporate raiders and others tendering for the shares companies that they must extend the period their offers are open key conditions are changed specifically the agency said those making tender offers for companies stock must extend the offers they decide eliminate conditions requiring minimum number shares tendered order for the offers valid tender offers typically include minimum share conditions result purchaser would not bound buy the shares that were tendered the minimum level were not reached interpretation current rules which officials said clarifies the sec present position the agency said tender offer must extended minimum share condition waived even the purchaser reserved the right the interpretation makes clear that waiving minimum share condition material change the tender offer under securities law sec officials said the sec has already said that other specific material changes such changes the percentage securities being sought the price being offered made during the course tender offer require day extension the offer the length the extension which aimed giving shareholders adequate chance assess revisions tender offer was not specified cases where the minimum share conditions were waived sec officials said the length the extension such cases would depend the facts and circumstances surrounding each case but would generally between five and days the agency cited two recent tender offers which waivers minimum share conditios were tried the last day each offer denying shareholders the chance react the new information officials declined identify the two offers bidder makes material change near the end its offer will have extend the offer permit adequate dissemination the sec said federal securities law requires that all tender offers remain open for least business days reuter

money-fx	agrees need strengthen ems european community finance ministers and central bankers agreed the need for greater cooperation strengthen the european monetary system ems against international market turbulence officials said there was general will reinforce the european monetary system with all that implies belgian finance minister mark eyskens said yesterday after hosting one day session informal talks this belgian coastal resort the gathering was the first such discussion since the second major realignment ems parities within nine months january the system has come under severe strain funds have flowed out the slumping dollar and into the dominant ems currency the west german mark sending soaring against weaker currencies the system but eyskens said february agreement between leading western industrialised nations stabilise exchange rates around current levels was working and this would allow the speed its efforts boost the internal stability the ems told news conference yesterday meeting agreed the need for closer coordination among ems member governments interest rate policies and interest rate differentials between different countries they also agreed they needed better coordination exchange market intervention hold currencies stable both when they reached their fixed ems limits and within their agreed margins but eyskens said this coordination raised whole range technical problems and ministers would discuss these further luxembourg june the basis proposals from the monetary committee and committee central bank governors said the needed set indicators economic convergence betwen community countries and was important that interest rates fulfilled this role together with exchange rates and inflation rates the belgian minister whose country presently holds the presidency the community made clear the meeting had not produced any agreement move radically forward developing the ems towards the long term goal economic and monetary integration have committed ourselves reestablishing the normal functioning the system eyskens said eyskens has repeatedly stressed that believes the ems has reinforced the plans liberalise all movements capital across national borders are ahead executive commission president jacques delors told the meeting the authority would put forward proposals for final phase capital market liberalisation october that would include safeguard clauses for member countries for which the move would create difficulties eyskens said the ministers and central bankers also discussed the need dedramatise realignments ems parities letting high ranking monetary officials carry them out telephone rather than calling meeting finance ministers however west german sources said bonn finance minister gerhard stoltenberg was unenthusiastic about the idea british chancellor the exchequer nigel lawson told journalists that one the technical issues raised greater coordination exchange market intervention was the question which currencies should used intervene and held central bank reserves said several ems member countries believed the ems would work better central banks held each other currencies issue particular importance regarding west germany since the bundesbank holds only dollars its foreign exchange reserves said the debate dedramatising ems realignments reflected general feeling among participants that the way the january reshuffle had been conducted was unsatisfactory the realignment was marked acrimony between france and west germany with each side blaming the other for strains the system that forced the parity overhaul reuter

money-fx	credit market outlook cautious trading bond trading likely remain cautious the near term with possible downward price bias market participants focus trends the dollar the economy and federal reserve policy economists said most expect the economy continue showing modest gains that the dollar has more room fall and that the fed will keep policy essentially steady perhaps for several months until trends are clearer the market can only attempt establish and hold new trading range higher interest rates said economists merrill lynch capital markets merrill lynch economists raymond stone and ward mccarthy said that while the fundamentals generally bode for healthy investment climate the market will have confidence this environment until there illumination and confidence dollar trade policy salomon brothers henry kaufman said the bond market highly sensitized dollar movements could encouraged currency markets seem stabilizing and overseas economic growth perceived slowing sharply the crucial question however how soon either these developments likely occur kaufman said market uncertainties and the erosion portfolio manager confidence could continue portfolio selling pressure while longer said philip braverman chief economist irving securities corp however braverman said that from longer term perspective current bond prices provide buying opportunity despite nearly one point bond price rebound friday unexpectedly weak march employment data key year treasury bonds lost points price for the week whole and thursday pct closing yield was high braverman said historical evidence suggests that long bond yield the pct area provides basis for optimism bonds closed pct friday the irving economist noted that three times last year similar paroxysm pessimism the key bonds reached similar closing yield high within three six weeks each instance however braverman said bond prices recovered bring the yield down sharply basis points mitchell held smith barney harris upham and inc said that many portfolio managers now believe yields could approach nine pct midyear which considers unlikely held said that since late smith barney analysts have spoken about the risk that interest rates could move higher and they continue believe that upward bias likely persist over the next few months held said that conversations with portfolio managers last week there appeared increasing belief that the rate rise had just begun and that yields could approach nine pct midyear naturally that would mean sharp bond price fall yields could rise further over the next few months but the rise should less than the basis point rise seen since the start the year held said most expect fed policy neutral for bonds near term the fed currently frozen into fixed stance said economists aubrey lanston and inc they said the fed cannot tighten policy and push interest rates might appropriate stabilize the dollar and head off renewed inflationary psychology that might harm the fragile economic expansion the lanston economists said the fed cannot ease its policy stance both foster more rapid economic growth and calm domestic and third world debt jitters without the threat causing further decline the dollar minutes february federal open market committee fomc meeting released friday showed that while the fomc left policy unchanged was more inclined firm rather than ease policy later conditions the economy foreign exchange credit markets warranted policy shift however economists generally believe that continued fairly sluggish economic growth and the financial strains banks resulting from their problem loans developing countries rule out any fed policy firming there broad agreement among economists that the fomc last tuesday meeting also left fed policy unchanged this week economic data are expected have little impact february consumer instalment credit numbers are due wednesday with march producer price data out friday there may mild relief some quarters that the grain	grain certs save mln dlrs amstutz the use generic commodity certificates certs for fiscal years will save the government mln dlrs department agriculture undersecretary daniel amstutz said speaking house agriculture subcommittee hearing the use the certificates amstutz said that the issuance billion dlrs certificates during fiscal years could result government outlays mln dlrs however the use certificates preclude the need for mln dlrs storage and handling costs resulting net savings for the government mln dlrs said without the use certificates amstutz said nearly the entire crop which had been put under loan would have been forfeited the commodity credit corporation ccc addition mln bushels grain that have been redeemed from ccc inventory through certificate exchanges would have remained the goverment inventory said when asked comment recent study the general accounting office that concluded certificates result net cost the government amstutz said gao underestimated the benefits and overstated the costs the certificate program amstutz said while certificates encourage more loan entries they also encourage heavier loan redemptions rather than forfeitures gao underestimated this net loan activity amstutz said there question the mind the department agriculture that these certificates have been very useful amstutz said immediate benefits certificates include greater market liquidity improved market price competitiveness higher farm income and improved debt situation and decreased carrying costs said certificates are integral part usda long range market oriented farm policy said amstutz told subcommittee chairman rep dan glickman kans that usda the process preparing official response the gao study certificates and will submit the subcommittee when completed reuter

grain	more grain certificates needed study says more generic grain certificates should released onto the market order for the certificate program have its full effect commodities according study sparks commodities inc the agriculture department should make grain deficiency payments and paid land diversion payments two third certificate one third cash ratio through fiscal year carroll brunthaver president sparks commodities told house agriculture subcommittee hearing certificates thereafter government payments should issued roughly split between cash and certificates brunthaver said the sparks study certificates examined two possible scenarios through the growing season zero certificate case where certificate program was assumed and alternative case labeled adequate certificate case which sufficient certificates would released that grain prices would not artificially supported market shortages due acreage reduction programs government holdings the study showed that total grain use under the adequate certificate scenario would exceed the zero certificate scenario pct usage would markedly more and when grain usage under certificate program was estimated exceed the zero certificate case pct for the five year period examined government expenditures under the adequate certificate case were billion dlrs pct less than under the zero certificate case the sparks study said that billion dlrs pct those savings resulted from smaller government storage costs the study also estimated that government grain stocks under the adequate certificate case would billion bushels below the zero certificate case the end the period examined the sparks study said that while certificates permit market prices fall below loan levels these lower prices increase commodity usage and reduce the net costs certificates versus cash reuter
